message_content: We've finished eating, and my waist is a bit sore. How about we do some activities here before heading back?
Lu Mingqiang: Dad, I think we need to fix that old section of water pipe on the balcony at home; otherwise, it keeps leaking. I'll go buy the materials this afternoon and work on it tomorrow morning.
Wife: Did you get everything from the hardware store? Did Xuanxuan behave well?
Me: I've bought it. The little one is particularly interested in screwdrivers, wrenches, and the like, asking questions nonstop. Now I'm going to pick up the filter, then walk home.

Me: While playing with my child today, I looked up some health information on my phone. Beer is actually quite high in calories, so I need to control my intake in the future. Also, late-night snacks can affect sleep, so I should be mindful of that.
Chen Jianguo: Mingqiang, regarding the possibility of opening your own studio that you inquired about at noon, I recall that securing clients is indeed a major issue.

Zhao Qiang: Master, could you tell me the specific search terms for the lumbar rehabilitation video you looked up on the sports health app during lunch? I have back pain and would like to refer to it.
summarized_info: Lu Mingqiang received a text message from his apprentice Zhao Qiang, inquiring about the search keywords used on the sports health app during lunch.

message_content: Toolbox maintenance completed, the multimeter probe wires have been repaired with insulating tape.
Chen Jianguo: Mingqiang, let's meet at the usual place tomorrow afternoon, the tea shop on Wenming Road. Don't forget.

Li Juan: Ming Qiang, regarding the plan for the family and small shop electrical repair studio we discussed last night, I thought about it later and feel that the direction is good, but wouldn't it be better to start by creating a more detailed budget and analyzing potential customers first? That way, we'll have a clearer idea.
Chen Jianguo: Mingqiang, the guests are happy to come at noon, let's discuss the coastal boardwalk project for next month.
Mingqiang, I've reviewed the price and content of that online course and agree to enroll. Let's finalize the study plan tonight.
Chen Bin: It was a pleasure meeting you while running today. After our brief exchange, I gained a lot!

Lin Feng: Qiang, after talking about training, I suddenly feel like going out for grilled fish. I know a new place that's open until late. Want to join?  
Me: Sorry, Feng, I really can't make it tonight. I have something important tomorrow and need to stay in good shape and get enough rest. Next time, after we get back to playing, it's on me.
Mr. Lu, your application for the Building Safety Course submitted today has been processed, and the fee deduction was successful. The study materials are available for download via the platform.

Hello Mr. Li, I have already left the company and expect to arrive at your store around 9:50 AM. Our main focus today is to go through the operational procedures to ensure you know how to use them. The operation manual and demonstration points are all prepared. See you soon.
Wang Lijuan: Mingqiang, remember you promised Hanhan to fly a kite this weekend? Don't forget to buy the kite string.

【Community Home Service Center】Dear Ms. Wang Lijuan, congratulations on being awarded the 'Community Service Star' award. The prize money of 500 yuan has been deposited into your account. Please stay tuned for further details regarding the award ceremony.
Lu Mingqiang: Zhao Qiang, the aging connector found in Unit 3 today, which was not indicated on the drawings, has been repaired. The multimeter measurement is normal.
Yesterday, I reviewed the basics of electrical engineering in the study and finally grasped that tricky chapter on starting and speed control. Now I feel much clearer about it.
Lu Mingqiang: On my way to send Hanhan to school, the car suddenly broke down on Nansha Road with abnormal engine noise. I pulled over to the side and am dealing with it now.

[Manager Liu] Mingqiang, regarding the support for your personal development mentioned in the meeting, the company's Human Resources Department has completed the process. Congratulations! The company has decided to fully fund all expenses for your application for the Senior Electrician Technician certification, including training, examination, and material fees. I will email you the specific application form and process details later. Prepare well!

Li Juan: Ming Qiang, I'm ready. Will you come back to pick me up right after dropping off the kids? Remember to bring my medical insurance card—it's in my bag. It's raining heavily today, so drive carefully.
Honey, I'm back from my workout. I bought breakfast—pineapple buns and soy milk—and left them on the table.
Lu Mingqiang: Jianguo, the exam is finally over! Let's meet at Xiuying Wanda Plaza at 11 a.m. to celebrate together.

Jianguo: Brother Qiang, there's an urgent job that just came up. The client Li Jianguo's store is having electrical circuit issues and wants us to check it out tonight. Are you available? We plan to arrive at the store around seven.
Honey, how's the pipe repair going? I heard the wrench slipped. Is your hand okay?
Meet at the usual spot after the morning run?

Hello Mr. Li! Thank you very much for your detailed explanation on the phone last night regarding the on-site verification method for the polarity of transformer differential protection wiring. I have noted the steps you mentioned involving the phase meter and plan to practice simulating it again in the next couple of days. Thank you once again!
Repair Shop Master Zhang: Mr. Lu, we have started disassembling and inspecting your car. The cost is the same as we discussed over the phone yesterday. You can just bring cash when you come tomorrow.

Hello Master Lu, I'm Boss Wang from the Xiuhua Road convenience store. Thank you for your hard work today. The circuit upgrade was completed so quickly, and after your explanation, I feel much more reassured about the electricity usage. The advantages you mentioned are indeed very important. Thank you so much!
Mr. Chen, during lunch today, I wanted to ask if you have any good restaurant recommendations that are suitable for taking the family to.
Mr. Lu, have you finished the inspection? Please remember to organize the data from the infrared thermometer and send it to me.

Zhao Qiang, the fault point has been precisely located 1.5 meters beneath the garden walkway. On-site observations reveal signs of breakdown arcing, which has caused a short circuit. The draft repair plan has been completed and awaits your feedback.

Wang Lijuan: Hello, Xiaoyu's mom. Our car will be in for repairs next week, so I was wondering if it would be convenient for you to give Zixuan a ride to school. If that works for you, we'd be happy to help out at another time as well.
Wang Lijuan: Remember the dinner rule? Whoever gets home first starts cooking. Today, it's your turn to prepare.
Squad Leader Zhang: We'll have a dinner gathering tomorrow evening at the usual spot, 'Wangji Grilled Fish Street Stall'. Everyone, please remember to be on time.
Engineer Lu, Master Li's transitional plan is highly practical. We have already begun implementing the temporary bypass laying according to the steps. Chen Jianguo
Mingqiang, remember to bring water and sunscreen when you go to Wanlv Garden tomorrow. I've also prepared water bottles for the kids.
Chen Jianguo: Engineer Lu, regarding the renovation plan for the old components we discussed this morning, shall we have a detailed discussion this afternoon?

Emergency Repair: The main circuit breaker of the distribution box in an old residential area on Haixiu Street, Xiuying District, has burned out, causing a power outage in two buildings. Most residents are elderly. Please proceed immediately to handle the situation.
Brother Lin, I've injured my wrist and can't move it. It hurts a lot. Can you come pick me up at the club right away? I need to go to the hospital. Are you here yet?

Lu Mingqiang: See you at the tea shop in the alley this afternoon?
Wu Gang: Sure, same place as usual. I’ll be there around two o’clock.
Jianguo, I have already confirmed with the supervisor about signing up for that competition at noon. What's your plan? Are you free to chat about how to prepare tonight?
Wang Hai: Mingqiang, what have you been up to lately? It's been a while since we last video chatted. Are you free to talk tonight?
Lu Mingqiang: Haizi! Just finished dinner after work. Sure, around nine o'clock, I'll get ready.
Wang Hai: Alright! By the way, have you been in touch with Gangzi lately? I heard something happened to him.
Lu Mingqiang: Huh? Gangzi? I haven't heard anything. What happened to him?

Wang Hai: I heard it from Brother Wei. It seems that last week, while repairing streetlights in the neighborhood, the ladder wasn't properly secured, and he fell, spraining his ankle quite badly. The doctor advised him to rest at home for at least half a month. In our line of work, safety always comes first!
Lu Mingqiang: Oh, really. I'll give him a call later to ask. Let's have a video chat tonight.
Lao Chen: Mingqiang, are you going to the flea market this weekend? I heard a new batch of old items has arrived, and there might be some hidden gems to find.
Lu Mingqiang: Old Chen, I have to accompany my child this weekend and can't make it. Please keep an eye out for good stuff for me.

Old Chen: Alright. By the way, didn't you mention last time that you were looking for some vintage bottles? What kind do you specifically like? Nowadays, many young people are into those flashy new bottles.

Lu Mingqiang: I still prefer the old stuff. Like those from the eighties and nineties, with labels on the bottles saying "State-Owned Local Winery" or "High-Quality Product." They look solid and carry the flavor of that era. My dad used to drink that kind of wine. The new bottles nowadays feel too light and lack that sense of substance.

Old Chen: Got it! Your taste is quite nostalgic. Those kinds of bottles are really hard to find nowadays, especially ones in good condition. I'll keep an eye out for you and let you know if I find anything.
Wang Hai: Mingqiang, are you busy? Are you free to video call tonight? I want to chat with you.
Lu Mingqiang: Just finished tidying up, I'm free. In half an hour?

Wang Hai: Alright! Perfect timing to share something with you. My uncle, my mother's younger brother, recently bought a new house in Longgang, Shenzhen. He just finished all the paperwork, and it really wore him out.
Lu Mingqiang: That's great news! Congratulations to your uncle. The housing prices in Shenzhen are quite high, aren't they?
Wang Hai: Yeah, it's quite stressful. But I've finally settled down. Let's have a video chat tonight to talk in detail!
Chen Jianguo: Mingqiang, I noticed you've been frequently sharing photos of machines on your social media lately. What's up? Have you developed an interest in photography?
Lu Mingqiang: Haha, you caught me. I'm just taking it easy after the exams, scrolling through my phone and came across some industrial photography. It's quite interesting.
Chen Jianguo: Oh? What kind of videos do you all like to watch? The ones that capture the entire construction site, or the ones that focus on us workers?

Lu Mingqiang: Not exactly the same. I particularly enjoy looking at those photos that capture circuit breakers and relays in extreme detail—the screws, copper busbars, and coils, all with a distinct texture under the light. It feels like they reveal another kind of beauty in the things we handle every day.
Chen Jianguo: Got it, so it's like a close-up shot of the equipment. You have a good eye. How about trying to take some photos of our toolbox with a phone another day?
Lu Mingqiang: The safety regulations I studied in the study yesterday were very useful, especially the part about work permits. I’ve organized some key points and will share them with you later.

Chen Jianguo: Mingqiang, how about having tea at the usual place at 3 p.m.? I have some questions about the wiring of the distribution box in the new residential area that I'd like to discuss with you.
Lu Mingqiang: Sure, Jianguo, no problem. Actually, I also have something I'd like to discuss with you.
Lu Mingqiang: Jianguo, have you been in touch with Haizi recently? He video-called me last night and talked for almost an hour. He seemed a bit down.
Chen Jianguo: Not yet, what's wrong with him? Is the business in Shenzhen not going well?

Lu Mingqiang: Yeah, he said the competition in Huaqiangbei is too fierce, and their store's performance has been stagnant for the past few months. The boss is putting a lot of pressure on him. He's still struggling with whether to just come back to Hainan, but he's afraid that his income will drop significantly if he returns, making it even harder to support his family. I can tell he's really troubled.
Chen Jianguo (Bottle Enthusiast): Mingqiang, are you free this weekend? I found two interesting bottles at the flea market. Want to take a look together?
Lu Mingqiang: Old Chen, I have to accompany my child this weekend. What does the bottle look like? Take a photo and show me.

Chen Jianguo (Bottle Enthusiast): [Image] One is a Hainan Deer and Tortoise Wine bottle from the early 1990s, made of glass, but the label design has a strong vintage feel. The other is a recently released minimalist-designed bottle from a certain brand in the past couple of years.
Lu Mingqiang: To be honest, Old Chen, I'm not very interested in these newly released, elaborately designed bottles anymore.

Lu Mingqiang: A while ago, while tidying up my father's old house, I came across a few empty bottles he had left behind from his drinking days. They were all from the 1980s and 1990s, with thick glass and yellowed labels. Holding them in my hand felt different. Now, I'm particularly keen on finding those old bottles with history and stories behind them, and I'm not as interested in collecting new ones anymore.
Chen Jianguo: Mingqiang, how about going to the new tea shop on Haisheng Road this afternoon? I heard their partridge tea is quite good.
Lu Mingqiang: Sure, Jianguo. It just so happens that we finished work early today. See you at 3:30?
Chen Jianguo: Alright. By the way, yesterday I went to deliver some yellow lantern peppers from my hometown to Master Li, and I heard him sighing deeply.
Lu Mingqiang: What's wrong with Master Li? Are you feeling unwell?

Chen Jianguo: It's not his health, but his son that's worrying him. His son is in IT in Shenzhen, and I heard his project recently fell through, so he's not doing well and wants to return to Haikou. Master Li is worried that his son won't find a decent job back here, as there aren't many IT positions in Haikou. But seeing his son working overtime until midnight every day over there, he feels for him. He's caught between a rock and a hard place.
Lu Mingqiang: Sigh, all parents are like this. Children and grandchildren have their own blessings, Master Li, don't be too anxious. Let's meet and chat this afternoon.
Chen Jianguo (Fellow Collector): Mingqiang, I heard a batch of vintage wine bottles arrived at the Dongmen Old Street flea market this weekend. Want to go check them out?
Lu Mingqiang: Sure, Old Chen. I've been collecting bottles lately, and my perspective has changed a bit.
Chen Jianguo (Fellow Collector): Oh? How so? Didn't you used to focus mainly on whether it's a famous brand or if it's soy sauce aroma versus strong aroma?

Lu Mingqiang: Those are still the basics, of course. But now I prefer to look for bottles with a "story." For example, bottles printed with "XX Anniversary of the Factory," "Special Edition for a Certain Year and Month," or simply a zodiac commemorative edition for a specific year. It feels like such bottles, when displayed, are not just wine bottles but more like markers of time.
Chen Jianguo (Fellow Collector): That makes sense! Items with special markings indeed have more of a collector's appeal. Let's focus on hunting for those this weekend!
【Hainan Rural Commercial Bank】Verification code 887654 is used for the transaction of your account ending with 1234. Please do not disclose it.
【Bank Reminder】Your account ending with 5678 made a consumption expenditure of RMB 8.00 at Ririlong Grocery Store on March 14 at 17:08.

Me: I went out for a run as planned this morning, and everything went smoothly. I also met a fellow runner on the way, and we chatted about our experiences with injury recovery, which was quite insightful.
Chen Jianguo: Mingqiang, I just heard you say the down payment is settled, really happy for you! Did your parents' loan come through? Now you can go ahead and pick a car without worry.
Lin Feng: What a coincidence running into you at Wanlv Park today! Don't forget about the event tomorrow night~ Since you won the prize yesterday, you owe us a treat for drinks!

Hello Master Chen, regarding the cooperation invitation you mentioned this afternoon, I have carefully considered it and discussed it with my family. I truly appreciate your recognition and kindness. However, due to considerations for my personal development plan, I am currently unable to join your new team. Wishing your new studio all the best!

Hello Mr. Lu, the electrician tool gift set you ordered this afternoon (including insulated screwdrivers, etc.) has been packaged and is ready for pickup at any time. Wishing your apprentice smooth progress in their work!
Lao Lu, today's tea chat was very pleasant. Thank you for your professional advice. I'll handle the water heater matter as you suggested.
Wang Hai: Mingqiang, are you busy? Are you free for a video call tonight? I have something I'd like to talk to you about, regarding my troublesome son.
Lu Mingqiang: Just finished dinner, not busy. Sure, let's make it 8:30. What's up with your kid again?
Wang Hai: Sigh, it's both infuriating and amusing to talk about. This kid, I don't know where he learned it from, has become obsessed with inventing things.

Wang Hai: Every day, he picks up discarded circuit boards, old batteries, and small motors from my shop and tinkers with them in his own room. Yesterday, he made something called an "automatic fish feeder," but the wires short-circuited and sparked, nearly setting his desk on fire! It scared my wife half to death.

Lu Mingqiang: Haha, this kid has ideas, just like you, always up to something. But safety first—you need to teach him the basics of electrical safety properly. I have some basic supplies like insulating tape and a multimeter here. Should I send some to you?

Lao Chen: Mingqiang, last week when I was in Wenchang, I saw two bottles of "Haikou Daqu" from the 1990s at an old wine shop. They're in pretty good condition, and the bottle caps are quite unique. Would you like to see some pictures?
Lu Mingqiang: Yes, please, Old Chen. Send it over quickly. I've been having some new ideas about the caps of aged wine bottles recently.

Old Chen: [Image] Look, it's this kind. The lid itself is ceramic, with the zodiac animal pattern of that year baked onto it. For the Year of the Dragon, it's a dragon; for the Year of the Tiger, it's a tiger. The type that you press down with your hand to seal tightly is what we call a "press-on lid."

Lu Mingqiang: Yes, exactly this kind! I’ve been really into these ceramic lids with zodiac patterns lately. They feel more interesting and nostalgic compared to the uniform metal screw-on lids we have now, and the patterns are also auspicious. I’m thinking about collecting a whole set based on the twelve zodiac signs, but the ones for the Year of the Monkey and the Year of the Horse are particularly hard to find.

Lao Chen: That's ambitious! This complete set is worth a fortune. Not only is the liquor valuable, but the caps themselves are works of art. I'll keep an eye out for you and let you know if I hear anything.
Lu Mingqiang: Jianguo, are you off work? I've finished today's work and I'm exhausted.

Chen Jianguo (Workmate): Just got home. You can say that again, the transformer debugging today was really tough. By the way, how is your brother's business in Shenzhen? I heard last time that his company has grown quite large.

Lu Mingqiang: Oh, don't even mention it. I had a video call with him last night, and he was really upset. He said that an old client he had been working with for several years had been dragging their feet on the final payment for nearly three months after the goods were shipped. He had followed up several times, but it was no use.
Chen Jianguo (Worker): Huh? That's not a small amount, is it? Will the company's cash flow be affected?

Lu Mingqiang: The impact is quite significant. He said the cash flow is a bit tight right now, and he's trying to figure out whether to take legal action or find a mediator to negotiate again. The risks in business are truly substantial. Our technical work is much more stable—payment upon delivery, straightforward and reliable.
Chen Jianguo (Collecting Enthusiast): Mingqiang, are you going to the Old Street Flea Market this weekend? I heard a stall just got a batch of old items, possibly including wine bottles.

Lu Mingqiang: Absolutely! I happen to have no overtime this week. I really enjoy hunting for those old bottles from the 1980s and 1990s—the glass ones with "State-Owned XX Winery" printed on them. They just feel so solid and nostalgic.

Chen Jianguo (Fellow Collector): Haha, your taste has never changed. I'm different—I prefer those limited-edition ceramic bottles produced by major manufacturers nowadays. They have a nice design and look impressive when displayed at home.

Lu Mingqiang: To each their own. I think the old glass bottles are more substantial, they record a piece of history. I'm not really interested in those new, flashy ones that are hyped up to high prices. How about we meet at the market entrance at nine o'clock on Saturday morning?
Chen Jianguo (Collecting Enthusiast): Alright, it's settled! Let's see if I can help you find a bottle from a state-owned factory with the character "Qiong" in its name this time.
Zhang Tou: Mingqiang, your contributions were recognized at today's regular meeting. The bonus has been arranged for distribution, please check and confirm receipt.
Chen Jianguo: Old Lu, are you busy? I have something to tell you that's both irritating and amusing.
Lu Mingqiang: Just got off work, Brother Jianguo, what's up? Let's hear it.
Chen Jianguo: Last week, I found an old wine bottle at the flea market. It's shaped like a gourd, quite unique.

Chen Jianguo: I placed it in the corner of the balcony, thinking to let the dust settle first. But this morning, my wife was tidying up the balcony and, seeing the bottle all dirty, she thought it was just an ordinary glass bottle and almost threw it into the recycling bag!
Lu Mingqiang: Haha, your sister-in-law meant well by tidying up. Luckily, you noticed it in time. It seems this bottle has a connection with you—it almost "flew away."
Lu Mingqiang: A-Qiang, have you been busy lately? I'd like to consult you about something.
Chen Zhiqiang: Brother-in-law, I just finished eating. I'm not busy, go ahead.

Lu Mingqiang: The air quality in Haikou has been fluctuating lately, and my child sometimes coughs. I'm thinking of buying an air purifier for our home. Since you're in Shenzhen and have more exposure to electronic products, do you have any reliable brand recommendations or key features to look out for?

Chen Zhiqiang: You've come to the right person! Our store also sells some small household appliances. Brother-in-law, you're mainly concerned about purification effectiveness and noise, right? I recommend you look at a few domestic brands—they offer great value for money, and replacement filters are easy to find. I'll send you a few models and specifications for reference later.
Lu Mingqiang: Alright, thanks for your help, Aqiang. The main thing is that it should be practical, durable, and not too noisy. I'll wait for your update.
Chen Jianguo: Mingqiang, how about having some traditional Hainan tea at our usual spot at 3 p.m.? My treat.
Lu Mingqiang: Good, I'll be there on time. I actually have something I'd like to discuss with you.
Chen Jianguo: By the way, Xiao Zhao sent me a WeChat message yesterday, saying that he has secured a job after returning to his hometown in Hunan.
Lu Mingqiang: Oh? What job did he find? Is he still working as an electrician?
Chen Jianguo: Well, he said he works as an electrician at a newly opened electric vehicle factory in Yongzhou City. The pay is decent, and it's close to home. That kid has finally settled down.
Chen Jianguo: Old Lu, have you come across any good bottles lately?
Lu Mingqiang: Just received one, in good condition. Old Chen, let me tell you, my taste has changed recently.
Chen Jianguo: Oh? Didn't you used to prefer the strong aroma of Sichuan liquor?

Lu Mingqiang: Yes, but now I feel that the sauce-aroma type from Guizhou has more flavor, and the bottle designs are also more elegant. Especially those from the old factories in Maotai Town—their bottle shapes carry a sense of history. Recently, I’ve been focusing on collecting in this direction.

Chen Jianguo: Haha, your taste has really gone up a notch! The soy sauce aroma type is indeed a classic, and the bottle is quite pleasing to the eye. Send me a picture of your new collection another day.
Old Lu, I noticed you're moving a bit stiffly today, so make sure to rest more. I've prepared something for you and will bring it over later. Take care of your back, and don't push yourself too hard.
Wang Hai: Brother Qiang, are you busy? Would it be convenient to have a video chat tonight? I'm feeling a bit unsettled.
Lu Mingqiang: Just finished dinner, not busy at all. Sure, let's make it nine o'clock. I'll get the kids settled first. What's up, Haizi? Work not going well?

Wang Hai: Oh, don't even mention it. Over here in Huaqiangbei, at the end of last month, a XX Digital Chain store opened right next to my shop. It's huge, brightly decorated, and they're really pushing their advertising.

Wang Hai: This month, I've clearly noticed that our regular customers are being drawn away, and new customers are more inclined to go to larger stores. My sales have dropped by nearly 30% this month. Seeing the shop so empty and quiet is truly disheartening.

Lu Mingqiang: It's indeed frustrating. Big stores have their advantages, but your old shop also has regular customers and a good reputation. Don't be too anxious. Let's have a video chat tonight to discuss in detail and see if there are any solutions.

Old Chen: Mingqiang, have you come across any good bottles lately? Last week, I went to Wenchang and saw a few glass bottles from the 1980s in an old supply and marketing cooperative, but their condition was just average, so I didn't buy them.

Lu Mingqiang: Recently, I've been busy preparing for certification exams, so I haven't specifically gone hunting for bottles. I haven't found any bottles, but I've gained some new insights into the taste of wine.
Old Chen: Oh? Do tell. Weren't you quite set on those local strong-aroma brands before?

Lu Mingqiang: Yes, I'm used to the strong aroma. But during the New Year, my brother brought back two bottles of blended aroma liquor from Shenzhen, said it was from Hubei. I tried it and found it quite interesting.

Lu Mingqiang: It's not as overpowering as pure strong-aroma baijiu. It feels smoother on the palate, and upon careful tasting, you can detect the roasted aroma typical of sauce-aroma baijiu, with a rich and lingering aftertaste. I now find this blended style of strong and sauce aromas more to my taste—it has both strength and finesse.
Wang Hai: Qiangzi, are you busy? Is it convenient to have a video chat? I'm feeling a bit upset.
Lu Mingqiang: Just finished eating, not busy. What's up, Haizi? I'll call you.

Wang Hai: Sigh, it's still that mess with the shop in Huaqiangbei. The landlord's contract is about to expire, and he says he wants to raise the rent by 40%. How can anyone keep going like this? I've been so worried these past few days that I can't even sleep.
Lu Mingqiang: That much of an increase? That's really harsh. So what are you planning to do? Renew the lease or look for a new place?

Wang Hai: I just don't know! Our regular customers are all in this area. If we move farther away, business will definitely be affected. But if we don't move, with the rent increase, our profits will shrink. It's really a tough choice. I still envy your stable life back in your hometown.
Lao Chen: Mingqiang, are you free this weekend? I've found two rather unique bottles. How about we meet up for a cup of tea and take a look?
Lu Mingqiang: Sure, Old Chen. Saturday afternoon at three, same place?
Lao Chen: Alright! By the way, you mentioned wanting to try something different last time. Have you discovered any good drinks recently?

Lu Mingqiang: There really is. I recently tried one that isn't the usual sauce-aroma or strong-aroma type we often drink—it's a blended-aroma type. It has a faint floral and fruity aroma when you smell it, and the taste is quite rich and layered when you drink it. I found it quite refreshing.
Old Chen: Oh? A blended aroma with floral and fruity notes? That's quite rare. What brand is it? Bring some over on Saturday to show me, I'd like to try this new flavor of yours.
Li Juan: Mingqiang, thinking about our decision from last night this morning, we should cut out those extra expenses like takeout and movie tickets first—they're not essential.
Chen Jie: I've thoroughly inspected that domestic SUV. It's in good condition, from 2022, and worth considering for purchase.
Wang Hai: Mingqiang, are you busy? I just got off the phone with Zhou Wei, and he vented for quite a while.
Lu Mingqiang: Just got home from work. What's up with Zhou Wei? Did he have another disagreement with his boss?

Wang Hai: It's not about work, it's his old Accord. It's been running for seven or eight years and has always been quite sturdy, but the transmission suddenly broke down a couple of days ago—it won't shift gears.
Lu Mingqiang: Oh, the car broke down. How much will it cost to fix it?

Wang Hai: I asked a few repair shops, and they all said that replacing parts plus labor would cost around eight thousand to ten thousand. It made him really upset, saying that amount of money would be enough to take his wife and kids on a trip. Fortunately, it doesn’t affect his work, as the company has a backup car. It’s just that paying for the repairs out of his own pocket really stings.
Chen Jianguo (Old Chen): Mingqiang, are you going to the old street flea market this weekend? I heard that a stall there has just acquired a batch of old wine bottles, possibly from Hainan.
Lu Mingqiang: I might have to spend time with the kids this weekend. By the way, Old Chen, my taste for alcohol has changed a bit lately.
Chen Jianguo (Old Chen): Oh? You used to be quite capable of drinking high-proof liquor, but now you've switched to low-proof?

Lu Mingqiang: It's not about the alcohol content. It's about the aroma type. I used to think that sauce aroma and strong aroma were potent enough, but now I find them a bit too overpowering. One sip and it feels like it's burning.

Lu Mingqiang: Last month, the foreman treated us to a drink, and I tried a blended-flavor type, I think it's called Baiyunbian? There's also a rich-flavor type from Hunan called Jiuguijiu. It felt like there were several flavors in one sip, not as strong, but with rich layers, much smoother. Now when I buy liquor myself, I pay attention to these kinds.
Chen Jianguo: Mingqiang, have you been busy lately? I went to the countryside to collect second-hand goods last week and found something really good.
Lu Mingqiang: Not bad, same as usual. What did you find? Send it over and let me have a look.
Chen Jianguo: [Image] Look, this is the 1998 Haikou Daqu. The bottle is in impeccable condition, with the right glaze color and complete labels. It's just that the tin lid is quite severely rusted.
Lu Mingqiang: This bottle is indeed rare! It's a bit of a shame about the rusty lid. What do you plan to do with it?

Chen Jianguo: That's exactly what I'm struggling with. If we leave it as it is, it looks awkward; if we have someone restore it, we might end up making things worse and lose the charm of the old piece. You have more experience, any suggestions?
Wang Hai: Qiangzi, what are you up to? Are you free for a video call?
Lu Mingqiang: Just finished tidying up, sure. What's up?
Wang Hai: It's nothing, just chatting. By the way, I've recently gotten into setting up a home theater and have been studying it every day.
Lu Mingqiang: What are you messing with again? Didn't we just change the TV not long ago?

Wang Hai: The TV is okay, but the sound isn’t great! Whenever I watch blockbusters now, I always feel like something is missing. I’ve got my eye on a Dolby Atmos sound system—the surround sound is absolutely incredible. The only catch is the price, which is a bit steep at nearly twenty thousand yuan. But when I think about being able to enjoy it after work, it feels worth it. I plan to buy it next month once I get my bonus!
Lu Mingqiang: Lao Chen, I'll be there around five o'clock. I need copper core wires of good quality, meeting national standards.
Chen Jianguo: Mingqiang, are you off work? Let's have some grilled fish tonight. See you at the usual place.

Lu Mingqiang: Jianguo, not tonight. Hanhan has a cough and needs to go back early. We also need to adjust our diet, as late-night snacks can be a burden. Let's reschedule for the weekend afternoon. I'll treat you to something light.
Chen Jianguo: Master Lu, the wiring terminal of the meter box in Building 3 has broken and needs immediate attention.
Chen Jianguo: Mingqiang, are you off work yet? Today, Xiao Zhao seemed a bit distracted while working and almost made a mistake.
Lu Mingqiang: Just got home. What's going on? Xiao Zhao is usually quite steady.

Chen Jianguo: Alas, something happened in his family. He told me during lunch that his father suddenly had a cerebral infarction back in his hometown in Hunan and was taken to the hospital. The situation seems quite urgent. He's worried about whether to ask for leave to go back, but he's also afraid of delaying work.
Lu Mingqiang: That serious? Then you should go back and take a look. Talk to Zhang about work matters; he should understand. I’ll also ask him later to see if there’s anything I can do to help.
Chen Jie: Mingqiang, the weather looks great this weekend. How about flying kites at our usual spot in Wanlvyuan at 3 PM? I've made a new swallow kite and want to test it in the wind.
Lu Mingqiang: Sure, I'll bring Xuanxuan along. By the way, didn't you mention last time that you have a friend working in logistics in Guizhou?
Chen Jie: That's right, my cousin, he runs the Guizhou route. What's up?

Lu Mingqiang: I've recently gotten into collecting wine bottles. I saw online that in Maotai Town, Renhuai, Guizhou, besides Maotai, there are many small distilleries with quite distinctive bottle designs. Some even use traditional techniques, resulting in simple and classic shapes. I was hoping you could ask your cousin to keep an eye out for me when it's convenient—specifically for empty bottles from those less common small distilleries. I'd like to collect a few.
Chen Jie: Oh, that's quite a unique interest. Alright, I'll ask my cousin about it later. A bottle from Maotai Town, right? I've made a note of it. See you this weekend!
Chen Jie: Mingqiang, have you been busy lately? The weather is nice this weekend, how about going to Wanlv Park to fly a kite?
Lu Mingqiang: A Jie, you're doing great on weekends. How have you been lately? Is business at the shop going well?

Chen Jie: Oh, don't even mention it. The landlord came to me a couple of days ago and said that starting next quarter, the rent will increase by 30%. The pressure is just too much. I'm really torn about whether to move the shop and find a cheaper place.

Lu Mingqiang: That much of an increase? That's quite a headache. You should carefully calculate the costs of moving the store and the customer flow at the new location. Let's discuss it in detail when we meet this weekend.
Chen Jie: Well, that's the only way. See you on the weekend, same place as usual.

Chen Jianguo (Hardware Store): Mingqiang, have you found any good bottles lately? I went to the flea market last week and saw a few Langjiu bottles from the 1970s and 1980s, but their condition was average, so I didn't buy them.

Lu Mingqiang: Old Chen, my interests have shifted a bit lately. I used to collect bottles from all sorts of brands, but now I’ve developed a stronger preference for bottles from our local Hainan distilleries. For example, the older bottles of Haikou Daqu and Coconut Island Deer Antler Wine—their designs carry a local flavor, and collecting them just feels more personal and meaningful.

Chen Jianguo (Hardware Store): Haha, so you're going back to the local scene, huh? That's a great idea. The local vintage bottles are scarce, making them more challenging to collect. I'll keep an eye out for you and let you know if I find anything.

Lu Mingqiang: Thanks! Mainly because I feel these bottles carry the memories of our generation, and they look familiar. Bottles of famous liquors from other places are certainly nice too, but they just don't feel quite "right."
Chen Jianguo: Mingqiang, how about having tea at the usual place at 3 PM? There's something I'd like to discuss with you.
Lu Mingqiang: Sure, Jianguo. I've just finished today's work, so let's meet at three.
Chen Jianguo: Have you heard? Xiao Zhao, that is Zhao Qiang, seems to be leaving.
Lu Mingqiang: Huh? I haven't heard about that. Isn't he doing just fine?

Chen Jianguo: There was a power company in his hometown of Yongzhou, Hunan that was hiring. He secretly went back for an interview last month and just received the notification that he passed. He said he’ll resign and return to his hometown next month. Sigh, young people always want to be closer to home.
Wang Lijuan: Honey, I was watching short videos today and saw someone converting their garage into a small workshop to take on some side jobs. It looks really nice.
Lu Mingqiang: Hmm, I've thought about it too. But the garage is too small to really work in. If we're going to open a studio, we need to choose the location carefully.
Wang Lijuan: So what do you think is the most important? Cheap? Or spacious?

Lu Mingqiang: Rent is certainly a factor to consider, but it's not the top priority. I think the most crucial aspect is location, preferably near old communities or industrial areas with many small factories and workshops.

Lu Mingqiang: Think about it, in places like this, there's a high demand for fixing household appliances or repairing factory machinery. Plus, being close by makes it easier for people to bring their items over or request on-site service. A steady flow of customers is what really matters.
Wang Hai: Mingqiang, are you busy? Are you free for a video call tonight? I have something troubling me and want to talk to you about it.
Lu Mingqiang: Just finished tidying up, I'm free now. What's up, Haizi? Is work not going well?
Wang Hai: It's not about work. It's an old colleague in our group, who I get along with quite well, recently got divorced.
Lu Mingqiang: Huh? So sudden. I remember his child is already in elementary school, right?

Wang Hai: Yeah. His wife and kids are back in their hometown in Hunan, while he's been working hard here all by himself, only going back once or twice a year. He said the feelings gradually faded, and after a few big arguments, they got divorced. Sigh, it's really disheartening to see. What's the point, really? For the sake of earning a little more money, he ended up losing his family. I don't think it's worth it at all.
Chen Jianguo: Old Lu, are you free this weekend? I recently found two quite interesting bottles. Want to take a look together?
Lu Mingqiang: Jianguo, I have to spend the weekend with the kids. What does the bottle look like? Send a picture to have a look.
Chen Jianguo: One is Langjiu from Sichuan, and the other is Dongjiu from Guizhou. Both are classic varieties and in good condition.
Lu Mingqiang: I've received the images. The bottle is nice, but my interests have shifted a bit now.
Chen Jianguo: Oh? How so?

Lu Mingqiang: In the past, I wanted any beautiful or unfamiliar bottle I saw, no matter where it came from. Now I feel that bottles from our local Hainan distilleries are more interesting. Old brands like Haikou Daqu and Yedao Deer and Turtle Wine have bottles with local characteristics. Collecting them feels more sentimental and carries more stories. Lately, I’ve been specifically looking for this kind.
Lu Mingqiang: The machine tool failure in the industrial park has been resolved today by replacing a damaged electrical component. The follow-up report is pending your organization.
Wang Hai: Qiangzi, how have you been lately? I'm almost driven crazy by the little emperor at home.
Lu Mingqiang: Haizi, what's wrong? Isn't your daughter Xiaoya quite well-behaved?
Wang Hai: What a good kid? He's in third grade of primary school and recently got addicted to mobile games. As soon as he gets home from school, he can't put his phone down.
Lu Mingqiang: That won't do, we need to intervene. Has it affected your grades?

Wang Hai: Exactly! Last unit test, she only scored a little over seventy in math, whereas she used to get above ninety. When I talked to her about it, she talked back, which really made my blood boil. Your Xuanxuan is so much easier to handle.
Lao Chen: Mingqiang, I went for a stroll around Fucheng Old Street over the weekend and came across an antique piece. I'm sure you'd love it.
Lu Mingqiang: Oh? What good stuff? I'm getting pickier and pickier about the bottles I collect now.
Old Chen: A glass bottle, looking somewhat aged, with the words "Serve the People" printed on it, probably from the 1960s or 1970s.

Lu Mingqiang: I love these "Old Eight Great" glass bottles with red slogans the most! Collecting them gives me the most satisfaction—they have so much more character than those flashy commemorative bottles nowadays. Last time I got a similar one, cleaned it up, and put it in the cabinet. Just looking at it makes me feel at ease.
Old Chen: Haha, I knew you'd be into that. The bottle's condition is just average. If you're interested, I can give you the stall owner's WeChat contact, and you can chat with them yourself?
Lu Mingqiang: Old Chen, have you come across any good bottles lately? I saw an old Wuliangye bottle at the flea market last week, but the condition was just average, so I didn't buy it.
Chen Jianguo (Collector): Don't even mention it, Mingqiang. I've recently taken quite a tumble and am feeling really down about it.
Lu Mingqiang: What's wrong? Did you make a mistake?

Chen Jianguo (Collector): Sigh, last month in an online collectors' group, an old man who claimed to be a retired employee of Moutai Distillery said he had an empty bottle of Feitian Moutai from the 1980s and wanted to transfer it. Looking at the pictures he posted, the bottle label and cap seemed quite old, so I was tempted.

Chen Jianguo (Collector): I spent over 800 yuan to buy it back and cherished it like a treasure. However, just a couple of days ago, I invited an old friend who truly knows the ropes to take a look at it at my home. At a glance, he said it was a high-quality replica from recent years, artificially aged. The bottle itself might only be worth a little over ten yuan. Over 800 yuan went down the drain, and I can't even begin to describe how frustrated I feel. From now on, I won’t easily trust those shady online sellers anymore.
Wu Gang: Mingqiang, I've noticed you've been posting a lot about electrical engineering theory on your Moments lately. Are you preparing for the senior technician exam?
Lu Mingqiang: Yes, theoretical knowledge is my weak point and needs to be improved. Just reading books is a bit dull, so I’m thinking of finding a reliable training program to study systematically.
Wu Gang: Any leads? I heard the Provincial Technician College seems to offer short-term skill enhancement courses for the public, and they have a pretty good reputation.

Lu Mingqiang: I'm also aware of the Provincial Technician College, but I feel their courses lean more towards theoretical systems and take a longer time. After asking around, I still think the "Weekend Electrician Intensive Course" at Haikou Advanced Technical School is the best fit for me.

Lu Mingqiang: Their course schedule is tight, with classes held on weekends, so it doesn’t interfere with my regular work. Moreover, many of the instructors are retired masters from the former power supply bureau, with rich practical experience. What they teach is more closely related to the problems we encounter in our actual work. That’s what I value most.
Chen Jianguo: Mingqiang, how about having some Dad's Tea at the usual place at 3 p.m.? I have something I'd like to discuss with you.
Lu Mingqiang: Sure, Jianguo. It's perfect timing since we finished work early today. See you in a bit.
Lu Mingqiang: Just got home. Hearing about Wang Hai's situation today, I really didn't expect it. He's such a shrewd person—how could he have stumbled over the goods?
Wang Lijuan: What did Jianguo tell you? What happened to Wang Hai?

Lu Mingqiang: Jianguo said he heard it from other folks from back home. Wang Hai's shop in Shenzhen brought in a batch of refurbished second-hand phones, and it's said that their origins weren't quite clear. As a result, they were caught by market supervision and fined quite a bit of money. Sigh, doing business still requires being down-to-earth.

Chen Jianguo (Fellow Collector): Mingqiang, I recently picked up a nice bottle—it's a Moutai Prince from a few years back, and it's in great condition. I remember you're quite fond of this one, aren't you?

Lu Mingqiang: Old Chen, you have such a good memory! I do like Moutai Prince the most. It's not that it's the most expensive, but its sauce aroma is just right, smooth on the palate, and doesn't give you a headache. It suits my taste better than the strong aroma of Wuliangye. Fenjiu is too sharp, and rice-aroma types like Sanhua Liquor always feel a bit lacking to me.
Chen Jianguo (Fellow Collector): Haha, an expert! Then I'll keep this bottle for you and bring it over for you to see when we have tea this weekend.
Lu Mingqiang: Great, thanks in advance! By the way, I also love drinking this kind of wine. I collect the bottles and occasionally enjoy a small drink—it's absolutely delightful.
Wang Hai: Qiangzi, I just finished a video call with Weige (Zhou Wei), and we talked about Gangzi (Wu Gang). He's been really unlucky lately.
Lu Mingqiang: Gangzi? What happened to him? We had tea together just last month.

Wang Hai: It was in early March. Their property service center in Meilan District was undergoing optimization, and he was laid off. He had been working in water and electricity maintenance for so many years, and just like that, he was let go.
Lu Mingqiang: What? So sudden? He didn't give any hint before. I need to make a call and ask.
Wang Hai: Well, Brother Wei said Gangzi is feeling a bit down lately and is asking around for a new job. As old classmates, we should lend a hand if we can.
Chen Jianguo (Old Chen): Mingqiang, meet at the tea shop this weekend? I've found an interesting bottle to show you.
Lu Mingqiang: Great, Old Chen. Actually, my taste has changed recently—I'm not as into those fancy glass bottles anymore.
Chen Jianguo (Old Chen): Oh? Changed your ways? What new style has caught your eye?

Lu Mingqiang: I've recently been particularly fascinated by the antique bronze-style bottles of strong-flavored baijiu, like those shaped like ding or zun vessels. They feel substantial and carry a sense of history.

Chen Jianguo (Old Chen): Haha, your taste has really gone upscale! What I found this time is a strong-aroma liquor bottle designed to imitate a Han Dynasty bronze wine vessel. I'll bring it over this weekend for you to take a look.
Chen Jianguo: Mingqiang, are you off work yet? It's been such a tiring day.
Lu Mingqiang: Just got home and about to have dinner. It’s been quite tiring—I checked the circuits in three buildings today. How about things on your end?
Chen Jianguo: Don't even mention it, I'm filled with anger. By the way, have you been in touch with your brother recently? I heard business isn't going well in Shenzhen either.
Lu Mingqiang: We just spoke on the phone last week. My brother has been a bit troubled lately—his company got scammed.
Chen Jianguo: Huh? What happened? Is it serious?

Lu Mingqiang: He said it was a client he had cooperated with once or twice before. This time, the client ordered another batch of goods worth about fifty thousand yuan. After the goods were shipped, the client disappeared, blocking all contact through phone and WeChat. My brother is really upset about this and says he’ll just treat it as a lesson learned, but he’s definitely feeling frustrated inside.

Chen Jianguo (Bottle Enthusiast): Mingqiang, are you free this weekend? My friend came back from Jingdezhen and brought a quite special porcelain wine bottle with a very beautiful glaze. Want to come over and take a look?

Lu Mingqiang: From Jingdezhen? Then I must take a look! I’ve been collecting vases lately, and I’m starting to find those with overly flashy designs less appealing. After seeing so many, they all start to look the same.
Chen Jianguo (Wine Bottle Enthusiast): Haha, so what's your current preference? Have you started researching those limited editions with potential for appreciation?
Lu Mingqiang: Not exactly. Whether it appreciates or not, we're not in it for the sale. Right now, I'm particularly fond of studying the "material" and "color" of the bottles.

Lu Mingqiang: For instance, whether it's glass or ceramic, coarse pottery or fine porcelain, how the glaze is fired, that texture—it looks especially captivating under the light. That's much more substantial than any brand story.

Chen Jianguo (Fellow Bottle Enthusiast): That makes sense! Your eye is becoming more and more "technical," truly befitting someone in the tech field. Let's meet at the usual spot this weekend afternoon. You're definitely going to love this bottle—its glaze is as smooth and warm as jade.
Chen Jianguo: Mingqiang, how was your National Day holiday? Did you take your wife and kids out for a trip?
Lu Mingqiang: I just went around Haikou, like Wanlvyuan and Holiday Beach, but there were too many people. How about you?
Chen Jianguo: I'm about the same. By the way, have you heard that Xiao Zhao went back to his hometown in Hunan for the National Day holiday?
Lu Mingqiang: I haven't heard about it. Going back to visit family?

Chen Jianguo: Haha, going back for a blind date! Arranged by the family, and I heard it worked out! This guy, he moves pretty fast. Now he probably wants to go back to his hometown to develop even more.

Lu Mingqiang: That's good news. He mentioned before that he wanted to go back, so now he has even more reason to do so. It might have some impact on our work arrangements here, but it's only human nature.
Lin Feng: Mingqiang, see you at the squash court on Wednesday night. I've noticed you've posted quite a few photos on your Moments recently, and they have a really nice vibe.
Lu Mingqiang: Thank you. It's just casual photography. I simply record interesting moments I come across during work.
Lin Feng: I noticed that you seem to be photographing old machines and worn-out parts? It's quite different from the landscapes or portraits that other photographers capture.
Lu Mingqiang: Well, I prefer photographing things that have been around for a while. Brand-new equipment may look beautiful, but it always feels like something is missing.

Lu Mingqiang: For instance, the rust spots on the old electrical meter boxes, under the slanting afternoon sunlight, the colors and textures, as well as the old relays that were taken apart—the copper plates inside have oxidized and changed color, but the structure remains incredibly precise. I feel these things have stories, embodying the craftsmanship and time of our trade. They photograph with an exceptional texture.
Lin Feng: Got it, what you've got is 'industrial retro style'! Good taste. Let's talk more in detail when we meet on Wednesday.
Wang Hai: Qiangzi, are you free tonight? I want to have a video chat with you; I'm feeling a bit down.
Lu Mingqiang: Just finished packing up the tools, I'm free now. What's up, Haizi? Feeling down about work?
Wang Hai: It's not about work; it's about my cousin. That guy is in Shenzhen and was supposed to get married at the end of the year, but now he's gotten himself into a big mess.
Lu Mingqiang: Cousin? What happened? Car accident or illness?

Wang Hai: It's even worse than that! He listened to the advice of a so-called friend and invested all the savings he had accumulated over several years for his wedding—over two hundred thousand yuan—into some virtual currency project, claiming it would double in value. Now the platform has disappeared, and he can't get a single cent back. His wedding will probably have to be postponed. Sigh, young people are too easily carried away.
Lao Chen: Mingqiang, are you going to the flea market this weekend? I heard a new batch of vintage items has just arrived.
Lu Mingqiang: I have to spend time with my kids this weekend. Old Chen, let me tell you, my interest in collecting bottles has changed a bit recently.
Lao Chen: Oh? Not chasing after Moutai zodiac bottles anymore?

Lu Mingqiang: Those are too expensive and too hyped up, not interesting. I now specifically look for bottles from old local distilleries in Hainan, like the short, stout ceramic bottles of the old Haikou Daqu, or the earliest batches of Yedao Deer and Turtle Wine with relief carvings.

Lu Mingqiang: Last month, I acquired a 1970s Haikou Daqu bottle from an elderly gentleman in Fucheng. The condition is particularly excellent, and there’s even a factory mark on the bottom. This kind of bottle is quite rare and records a piece of our local history. It feels much more rewarding than collecting those famous liquor bottles that can be found all over the country.
Wang Hai: Brother Qiang, how have you been lately? I've been dealing with some troubles and wanted to chat with you about them.
Lu Mingqiang: Haizi, I'm doing okay. What's going on over there? Having trouble at work?

Wang Hai: Yeah, the market here in Huaqiangbei has been really tough this year. Our store's sales have dropped by almost 30%. The company headquarters is putting pressure on us, saying we either have to accept a pay cut or possibly be transferred to stores in other cities. Sigh, after all these years in Shenzhen, with my wife and kids here, I really don’t want to move.
Lu Mingqiang: It's indeed a tough situation. Is the salary reduction significant? Where is the transfer to?

Wang Hai: The salary reduction is about 15%. As for the job transfer, I might be assigned to a new store in Huizhou or Dongguan, with the same position, but the market there is less familiar to me. I'll try to negotiate further with the company.
Chen Jianguo: Old Lu, how about going to the tea shop this weekend? I recently found a vintage 1980s Dongjiu bottle in pretty good condition.

Lu Mingqiang: Sure. Dongjiu is a medicinal aroma type, right? I still prefer the bottles of sauce aroma type, as I feel the craftsmanship is more complex and the bottle shapes are more grand. For example, old bottles like Moutai and Langjiu are just pleasing to look at.

Chen Jianguo: Haha, you're truly a die-hard fan of sauce-aroma baijiu. As for me, I collect all aroma types, mainly focusing on the bottle design and history. So, have you gotten any good finds recently?
Lu Mingqiang: I recently acquired a bottle of Xijiu from the early 1990s, also a soy sauce aroma type, and it's in fairly good condition. I'll bring it over for you to see this weekend.
Jianguo, confirmed with the supplier. The new switch will be delivered to the repair shop tomorrow morning, along with the fan and cables. We’ll proceed with replacing the switch as planned tomorrow.

【Alipay】Verification code 952713 (please do not disclose). You are currently making a payment of 99.00 yuan, payer: *Mingqiang. If this is not your own operation, please do not disclose the verification code.

Jianguo: Mingqiang, I had a great time chatting with you tonight. Wishing you the best of luck in your senior technician exam! I'll send you the link to the review materials we mentioned earlier as soon as I get back. Zhaoqiang also said he’d look for some practical tips when he returns. Let’s all take care of ourselves and remember to balance work with rest!
Lin Feng: Brother Lu, the squash court is booked for tomorrow Wednesday evening, same time at 19:30. Don't be late.

Jianguo, regarding the relay oxidation and the fault point in that complex circuit discovered this morning, I took photos and made notes. Also, regarding the website link for the online question bank and practical operation videos for senior electrician technicians that I mentioned to you last time, I will send it to you on WeChat later. Please check if it is helpful for your certification exam.

Lu Mingqiang: Received, the commuting arrangement is settled. I'll mainly ride my electric scooter. Tomorrow, I'll ask Lao Zhang to see if it's convenient for him; I'll catch a ride with him when the weather is bad. We'll go over the other expense controls again tonight.

Jianguo: Mingqiang, how about that grilled fish this weekend, can you make it? The guys all remember you mentioned having stomach issues last time, so we can switch to something lighter if needed. Waiting to hear from you.

Jianguo: Mingqiang, how about that grilled fish this weekend, can you make it? The guys all remember you mentioning your stomach wasn't feeling well last time. If it's not suitable, we can switch to something lighter. Waiting for your reply.

Brother Feng, we need to plan our household expenses recently, and my old back isn't feeling too great either. As mentioned in this morning's memo, I'll have to take a break from our basketball games for a while—really sorry about that. I'll switch to taking walks around the neighborhood in the evenings to keep myself active.
Hello Mr. Lu, the balcony light is still not working. Are you available to come and take a look today? Sorry for troubling you again.
Uncle Wang, I'll come over to help you check the chandelier after my evening walk, and I should arrive around 8:30.
Lu Mingqiang: Okay, see you tomorrow morning.
Lin Feng: Mingqiang, meet at the usual spot tonight, don't forget to bring the gear.
Lu Mingqiang: I've been busy at the project site all day today, and my shoulders are a bit sore. I might have to keep an eye on things again tomorrow.
Chen Bin: Let's meet at the usual time and place tomorrow morning, at the coastal track of Baishamen Park. We'll gather at 7 o'clock. The weather is nice, so we can have a relaxed run.

Honey, the community gave me a 'Outstanding Domestic Service Worker' commendation certificate today! I'm so happy! But my back was a bit sore again while cleaning the windows today. I really need to take care of my health in this job.
Mingqiang, remember to bring the tea and pastries we bought the other day when you go to Aunt Wang Xiuying's house this afternoon.

Son: Dad, I've started paying attention to exercising recently, but my lower back feels uncomfortable from sitting too much. Since you used to work as an electrician, do you have any stretching methods for the lower back that are suitable for office workers like us?

Master Li: Mingqiang, regarding the career development we discussed last time, don’t forget to consider applying for the senior technician certificate. Stability is key—first build a solid foundation before taking action.
Uncle Wang, regarding the installation issue we discussed during our meeting this afternoon, I've given it some thought and realized that safety aspects need to be taken seriously.
Uncle Wang, the light is working fine now. Please be careful with electricity usage, and feel free to call me anytime if you need anything.
I've been adjusting my social diet lately. For the sake of work performance and health, I generally avoid drinking gatherings now.
It's rare for old classmates to get together, and I understand your health plan, but it's okay to make an exception occasionally. See you at XX food stall tonight?
Lao Wang, the commemorative coins we got at a bargain last time are indeed in excellent condition and have been well-received in the market. Thanks for the heads-up this time!
Old Lu, I've sent the electrician certification materials we talked about last time to your email. Please take a look when you have time.

【Hainan Provincial Vocational Skills Appraisal Center】Dear examinee Lu Mingqiang, you have passed the theoretical written examination for Senior Electrician Technician. The practical assessment arrangement will be notified in the near future. Please keep your phone accessible and stay updated with the official website information.
contactName: Hainan Provincial Vocational Skills Appraisal Center

message_content: Old Lu, I saw your article in "Electrical Engineering" – it's very solid and thoroughly explains that tricky case! Mr. Wang from the company's technical department also praised it in the group chat, saying it's a perfect example of combining practice with theory, and he plans to apply for a special reward for you! Congratulations!
Squad Leader Zhang: Mingqiang, remember to go to the Bihailantian community with Jianguo for the spring safety inspection after the morning meeting today.
Li Juan: Remember to watch the big kite made by Mingqiang in the evening, the children are really looking forward to it.
Mr. Zhang, my back injury has flared up again. Could you arrange for me to work as an on-site technical supervisor today to avoid heavy physical labor?
Wang Jianguo: Mingqiang, thanks for fixing the light! Neighbors should always help each other out. Looking forward to your test run tomorrow evening.

'Xiuhai Power Renovation Project Task Force' Chen Jianguo: Everyone, the inspection is scheduled for this afternoon. Please conduct a final check this morning to ensure everything is in perfect order. Engineer Liu and Director Wang will both be attending.

Jianguo, the power has been cut off on site in accordance with safety regulations, and the old distribution box is being dismantled. We encountered rusted bolts and are currently handling them with tools. The work is expected to proceed as planned.

Engineer Lu, we've just received a notification that the Binhai New Village community has experienced a power outage due to a lightning strike, requiring urgent repairs. Please proceed to the site as soon as possible.

【Provincial Skill Appraisal Center】Dear Mr. Lu Mingqiang, your practical assessment results for the Senior Electrician Technician (Level Certification) have been evaluated and passed. The electronic version of the professional qualification certificate will be generated within 15 working days. Please stay tuned for further notifications.
Wang Jianguo: Mingqiang, thanks to you yesterday, otherwise it wouldn't have been safe to go in and out at night. The new light bulb is very bright! Uncle Wang.
Cousin, I've been thinking about starting my own electrical repair workshop recently. How do you think the market is? Any suggestions?
Master, good evening. I have a theoretical question that I've been struggling with while reviewing, and I'd like to ask for your help to take a look. Please reply when it's convenient for you.
Wife: The results of the family financial stress test are out. The entrepreneurial plan is on hold for now. We need to increase our stable income first.

Me: Old Chen, regarding the topic of taking on freelance projects independently that we discussed last time, I’ve given it some careful thought. For now, I’ll stick to the original plan—first, see through a few major projects at the company to solidify my reputation and client relationships. As for your leads on technical partners and initial startup funding, please keep an eye out for me when it’s convenient. This isn’t something that can be rushed; it needs to happen naturally when the conditions are right.

Lijuan, I've recently turned down some barbecue dinners to focus on taking better care of my health and allowing my wrist to recover sooner. This way, I can spend more time with you and the kids, and also work with greater peace of mind and concentration.

Lao Li: Mingqiang, a few old friends from the factory said they'd like to get together next week. It's on February 1st at 6 PM, same old place. Are you free?  
Lu Mingqiang: Thanks for thinking of me, Brother Li. I've got some family matters to attend to recently, so I might not be able to make it on February 1st. Hope you all have a great time—let's plan for next time!
Master Lu, I'll be at the company soon. Today, we're heading to the Haidian Island construction site in the yellow engineering vehicle. See you in a bit.
Uncle Wang: Mingqiang, my ceiling light is broken again. Could you please come and take a look tonight?
