message_content: Lao Chen, my back wasn't feeling quite right after we finished work yesterday. When I bent down to pick up tools while changing the transformer, I suddenly straightened up and felt my back sore and stiff. It took me a while to recover.

Bro Feng, thanks for the guidance yesterday! The stretching exercise you taught me felt much more comfortable afterward, and I feel it really helps with lower back strength. I'll come to you for advice again when I work on my core strength.

Lu Mingqiang: Jianguo, I've sent the list of tool models and the stock quantity we discussed today to your email for your reference when placing orders. Don't forget the most important thing: all electrical tools must be certified with the 3C mark. Safety is no small matter.

Rehabilitation Instructor Dr. Chen: Today, three sets of core strength training were completed as planned. The sensation in the lower back has been much more stable lately. Continuing to adhere to this targeted training regimen should lead to further improvement.

Rehabilitation Instructor Dr. Chen: Today, three sets of core strength training were completed as planned. The sensation in the lower back has been much more stable lately. Continuing to adhere to this targeted training regimen should lead to further improvement.
I replied: Good morning, Brother Bin. I can't join the run anymore. I've been focusing on exam preparation lately, and my schedule is very tight. Hope you all have a great run.

Mingqiang, we had a thorough conversation tonight. Although the new opportunity offers attractive income and flexible working hours sounds appealing, upon careful consideration, we believe that family stability and your long-term development are the priorities at this stage. Changing jobs involves significant risks, and neither of us is inclined to pursue such adventures. Since your current platform is stable and supports your continued focus on technical expertise, it’s best to concentrate on preparing for the senior technician exam for now. I support your decision to respond according to the direction we discussed.

Juan: You've been rubbing your waist since you got home. Are you too tired from the emergency repair today? Is your waist hurting badly again? I told you last time not to push yourself with exercise, but you never listen. This time, you have to listen to me.

Lao Lu: Indeed, I can't exert any strength, so I'll follow your advice this time. Let's put our plans for playing basketball and going for a morning run on the weekend on hold for now, and we can revisit them once I'm feeling better. I'll also ask the doctor about it during my check-up next week.

Wife: Let's start implementing those dietary adjustments you mentioned last night from tonight's dinner. I only served half a bowl of rice and stir-fried an extra plate of vegetables. Let's stick to it together.

Wife: I've scheduled an appointment with the insurance company to sign the contract tomorrow afternoon. I've sent you the plan. Let's go through it together tonight, and if everything looks good, we'll finalize it.
Wife: The contract has been signed, and the first premium has been paid. The electronic policy has been sent to your email, please remember to check it. I feel much more at ease now.

Lu Mingqiang: Brother Feng, my lower back has been a bit sore since I played squash on the 16th, and I've been a little concerned about it. You mentioned last time that core training is very helpful for protecting the lower back. Would it be convenient for you to teach me at the gym tomorrow? I want to learn it systematically.

Lijuan, regarding the austerity plan we discussed tonight, I think it still needs further refinement. Especially when it comes to the children's expenses, we need to find a gentle way to communicate with them.

Colleague Lao Zhang: Mingqiang, I noticed you were moving a bit stiffly while bending over to work today. Is your back injury acting up again? The workload outdoors has been quite heavy these past few days. Make sure you rest well when you get back, and don’t push yourself too hard.

Jianguo, thanks for the invitation, but I really can't make it for the late-night snack tonight. The project has been putting a lot of pressure on me lately, and I've been working overtime non-stop. Plus, I need to watch my diet a bit. Let's do it another time—my treat!
Lijuan, the dinner party has just ended. I didn't drink much tonight, only had some tea, and mainly ordered light dishes. Everyone had a pleasant conversation.

Old Lu, you're welcome! The 'Skills Online' platform is quite reliable. Just choose the courses based on the areas you need to strengthen the most, and they will send the textbooks later. Study hard, and I look forward to your good news.

Brother Jianguo, I just finished my work here, and my old ailment seems to have flared up again. My back is hurting badly, so I won't be able to make it to the afternoon shift. I need to ask the team leader for a few days off to rest. Could you also let Qiangzi know for me?
Wife: The kids had a great time at today's outdoor activity, and they really enjoyed flying kites.
Wang Lijuan: Mingqiang, I see you're always on your phone late at night lately. Are you thinking about starting a business again? Make sure to get some rest.
Lijuan, I have noted down the decisions from the meeting. Tomorrow, I will first inquire about the specific procedures for vehicle scrapping and the estimated residual value.
I won't go for a run this afternoon; I'm feeling a bit tired.
Lijuan, my lower back feels much better this morning, which is a positive sign. Let's work together to create a rehabilitation plan tonight to ensure long-term health.

Lijuan: Mingqiang, my back suddenly hurt a lot this afternoon, and I couldn't move. I'm now at the hospital waiting to see the doctor. The doctor's initial diagnosis is lumbar muscle strain. I'll talk to you about it when I get back tonight.
Lijuan, the project bonus has been credited, amounting to 1500 yuan. Let's discuss how to allocate this money together during dinner tonight.

Me: Today, I taught Zihan how to systematically organize his schoolbag—placing books by size, keeping homework notebooks separately, and putting the pencil case in the side pocket. I had him practice it twice. Take it slow; habits are built step by step.

Mr. Zhang, thank you for your kind offer. However, after careful consideration, I find the timeline for this project too tight. I'm concerned that rushing the construction could lead to safety hazards, and the craftsmanship might not meet the required standards. To be responsible, I have decided not to take on this job.

Just sent you the link to the article on preventing sports injuries that we mentioned earlier. Feel free to check it out when you have time. [Link: Health Path - Common Sports Injury Prevention Guide]
Lu Mingqiang: Tonight's walk is canceled due to bad weather. Let's exercise at home instead.

Lijuan, I ate too much at the workmates' grilled fish gathering tonight, and now I'm feeling bloated and dizzy, really uncomfortable. We really need to pay attention to our diet from now on and try to keep it light.

Lijuan, I just came out of the hospital. The doctor said the back injury is quite serious—it's fasciitis, and I must stay in bed for at least a week, completely unable to do any work. Jianguo brought me back.
Lu Mingqiang: Just got off work. The task of inspecting and repairing the distribution box this afternoon was too tedious and drained all my patience. I'm completely exhausted.
Lu Mingqiang: Old Li, I have to cancel this weekend's gathering. After my car was scrapped, I'm financially tight and need to save money.
Mingqiang, the on-site photos and preliminary report of the grounding fault at the Sanya project have been sent to your email. Please analyze them when you have time.

Master Chen, hello. I would like to confirm the content of our phone conversation from last night. Thank you very much for your appreciation and invitation, but after careful consideration, I have decided to stay with my current company. My primary goal at the moment is to focus on my existing platform and exam preparation, and I hope you can understand. Thank you once again!
I have an important exam tomorrow, so I need to rest early tonight to recharge. Could you help me dim the lights?
I have an important exam tomorrow, so I need to rest early tonight to recharge. Could you help me dim the lights?

Lu Mingqiang: Jianguo, that job this morning was really exhausting, my back is almost broken. Those old-style transformers are truly difficult to install, I had to keep twisting bolts in that posture. Next time, we really need more people to take turns for such outdoor tasks.

Li Juan: Mingqiang, have you seen the tree-planting activity notice from the property management? It’s this Sunday morning, and it’s free. Let’s take Zixuan and Zihan with us. We can treat it as a weekend family activity—the kids will definitely be happy.

Mingqiang, let's go to the bank today to deposit the year-end bonus. As we discussed last night, we'll put most of it into fixed deposits for emergency reserves and the education fund, and set aside a portion for Spring Festival expenses.
Lin Feng: Are you back from the hospital? How is your wrist?
Master, could you provide some guidance on the key points and challenges in preparing for the Senior Electrician Technician exam?
The theoretical exam is finally over, so I'll take a few days to rest and adjust my state. Tomorrow, I'll resume playing squash. Same time, same place!
summarized_info: Lu Mingqiang sent a text message to schedule a squash session with the coach.

message_content: Uncle Wang, I checked the socket this afternoon. The model is Delixi CD606. It's recommended to buy the new version with a switch, as it's safer and more convenient. You can find it at hardware stores or online. Remember to turn off the circuit breaker for that circuit before replacing it.

Tonight's conversation has given me a lot to think about. Ensuring our family's health coverage is a top priority. I'll start by looking for suitable insurance products online over the next few days, and we can go to the community center together this weekend to get more detailed information about the policies.
【Bank Notification】Your account ending with 1234 has received a payment of 500 yuan from a second-hand platform transaction.
Master, hello, I am Mingqiang. Regarding the senior technician exam, I have some questions I would like to consult you in person. I was wondering if you are available tomorrow or the day after?
Jianguo, what is the policy number for our company's group accident insurance? Could you also send me the coverage details? I'd like to learn more about it.

Viagra, I've been idle recently while recovering from my injury, thinking about what to do in the future. You have extensive experience running a repair shop, and I'd like to learn from you when it's convenient—things like startup capital and finding a storefront.
Lu Mingqiang: The evening workout is canceled. I'm too exhausted from installing the distribution cabinet during the day, and my body can't handle it.
Ming Qiang, the three-day family event has finally come to a successful conclusion. Everyone had a great time these past few days, especially the birthday dinner the day before yesterday.

Mingqiang, regarding the insurance matter we discussed last time, I referred you to the agent Zhang Wei. His WeChat ID is zw138***, and his phone number is 138****5678. I just had a brief chat with him on WeChat. Please add him for more detailed inquiries.
Lu Mingqiang: For lunch today, I ordered qing bu liang and blanched choy sum. I ate too greasy yesterday, so I need to have something light.
Mom: Mingqiang, are you coming home for dinner tonight? I've made braised pork and a few other dishes.
Chen Bin: Mingqiang, I recently discovered a really useful app and wanted to recommend it to you. It might be helpful.
Lao Zhang, today's event was quite enlightening. Although managing people doesn't seem easy, I learned a lot. Let's catch up more when we meet at the company.
Lin Feng: Ming Qiang, how did you feel about today's recovery training? I noticed your footwork was better than expected. Is your wrist feeling okay?

Brother Minghua, thank you for your entrepreneurial proposal. I have carefully considered it and feel that I need more time to evaluate, especially to balance family and risk. I plan to conduct some market research first, so for now, I will treat it as a long-term project.

Wife: Mingqiang, let's go buy groceries. We had too many mooncakes and crabs yesterday, so let's keep dinner simple today. We can make some tomato and eggs, some green vegetables, and a light pork rib soup.

Lu Mingqiang: Hello, Mr. Li, sorry to bother you. I’d like to help a friend inquire about something. If they want to open an appliance repair shop, roughly how much startup capital would be needed? What are the fixed costs like monthly rent, utilities, and purchasing parts?

Mr. Li: You're too kind, Mr. Lu. The startup cost depends on the location and scale; for a small shop, it's around a hundred thousand yuan. Rent is the biggest expense, with a decent location costing four to five thousand per month, utilities a few hundred, and spare parts inventory depending on the business volume. The hardest part is attracting customers. New shops lack reputation, so you need to actively engage with the community, build relationships with property management, or promote on online platforms. Repeat customers rely on craftsmanship and integrity.

Lu Mingqiang: Understood, thank you, Boss Li! These insights are truly practical. I have another question: in daily operations, aside from attracting customers, what do you think is the biggest challenge? And how can we better retain our regular customers?

Boss Li: Challenges? Well, technology evolves fast, so you have to keep learning. And there's the issue of delayed payments—some organizations are slow to settle their bills. As for maintaining customer relationships, it's about being straightforward and honest: keep prices transparent, leave a contact number after repairs, and be available for any follow-up questions. Sending greetings during holidays also helps. Gradually, your reputation builds up.
Mingqiang, my back still hurts, and the diagnosis is lumbar muscle strain. Have you got any results from the insurance consultation?

Lu Mingqiang: Jianguo, are you busy? My return to work after the May Day holiday is basically confirmed. The company has assigned me to mainly handle 'technical supervision,' responsible for guidance and review. Specifically, I'll be following up on the old residential area circuit renovation project in Xiuying District. I'm quite anxious lying in bed. If it's convenient, could you send me the electronic version of the project drawings first? Also, what's the current progress of the project? Have there been any difficulties? And regarding safety operation standards, you must remind the on-site brothers more often.  

Chen Jianguo: Old Lu, just focus on recovering. I'll organize the drawings and current construction records and send them to your WeChat. Progress is going fairly smoothly, though a few old pipelines are more complex than expected. We can discuss the details when you return. Don't worry about safety—I remind everyone about it every day. The technical supervision role you've been assigned is great and suits your current situation well.
Mingqiang, come over for dinner tonight. Mom made your favorite braised pork.

Brother, regarding the entrepreneurial proposal, after careful consideration, I feel it's not quite suitable at the moment. Our family savings are insufficient, I still need to prepare for the senior technician exam, and my back injury requires rehabilitation. I'll have to politely decline for now, but thank you for your kind offer.

Captain Chen: Mingqiang, you did a great job completing the on-site inspection of the community's power facilities yesterday. I have already organized the relevant materials, so I'll leave the report section to you.
Wang Lijuan: Everyone had a great time at yesterday's gathering, and the kids said it was the best birthday celebration. The weekend family event concluded successfully.

Mr. Lu, I noticed you were taking notes very attentively during the meeting today, and you didn’t take much of a break afterward before taking us to get the equipment. I know you’re under a lot of pressure, but you still need to eat on time—health is the foundation of everything. How about I bring you some fruit tomorrow?
summarized_info: Lu Mingqiang received a text message from his colleague Zhao Qiang, in which Zhao Qiang observed that Lu Mingqiang was highly dedicated to his work and under significant pressure, and reminded him to eat on time.

message_content: Dad, the three-day event is over, and I have to go back to school tomorrow. I really don’t want to leave. I had such a great time these past few days, especially on your birthday!
Ming Qiang, I've looked at the physical examination report. Let's adjust our diet: eat less rice for dinner, have more vegetables, limit eating out and fried foods. Also, be mindful of your work.

Wang Lijuan: Mingqiang, dinner is ready. We had such a rich meal for the Mid-Autumn Festival reunion yesterday, and you said you felt a bit too full. Let's have something light today to balance it out.
Everything is ready on my end. See you at the park tomorrow—the weather should be nice.

Jianguo, today at the meeting, Boss Zhang mentioned that the company encourages us to take the advanced technician certification exam and offers subsidies. I’m thinking maybe I should start preparing for it too, after all, I’ve been doing this for over ten years.

You're right, both of us have decent skills, so we should aim higher and take the exam. I've looked into it, and this year's exam is scheduled for late October. Starting to study and practice now is just the right time.

Master Li, I'd like to inform you that I plan to register for the Senior Electrician Technician exam this October. When you took the exam back then, which part was more challenging for you, the theory or the practical section? I want to focus my preparation in advance.

Mingqiang, well done! The new regulations in the theoretical part and the analysis of complex circuits are the challenging points, so you'll need to put in the effort. The practical exam mainly tests your comprehensive troubleshooting skills and the installation standards for new equipment. You have a solid foundation, so it shouldn't be a big problem—just make sure to review systematically. I still have some old materials here; I'll bring them to you another day.

Old Chen, I went to visit relatives in the countryside over the weekend and unexpectedly found a bottle of local liquor from the 1980s in the old supply and marketing cooperative warehouse. The bottle features a design of coconut trees at sunset and is remarkably well-preserved! It truly feels like stumbling upon a treasure.

Really? Is the design a red background with a large coconut tree and the words "Qiongzhou Fine Brew" next to it? If so, that might be one of the earliest trial products from Coconut Island Winery, with extremely limited stock! You're so lucky!

Dad, regarding that vintage bottle of liquor I mentioned I found last time, my drinking buddy Lao Chen said it's from Haikou Coconut Island Winery. When you were working at the power supply bureau back then, did you ever hear about this winery?

Coconut Island Winery? I remember it! It was at the eastern end of the old Haifu Road, but it closed a long time ago. Their factory director even came to our bureau to install electrical wiring. If that bottle of wine you have is from them, it really is a keepsake. Take good care of it.

Ajie, the weather forecast says the wind will be good at Wanlvyuan this Saturday afternoon (April 12th). How about we go try out my newly improved "Swallow" kite? I added some weight to it, so it should be more stable.
Alright, Brother Mingqiang! I've just finished repairing my "Dragon-Head Centipede" kite too. Let's meet at the usual spot in Wanlü Park at 2 PM this Saturday!

Ajie, I just received an urgent notice from the company. There's an emergency repair task scheduled for Saturday afternoon (the 12th), so I won't be able to make it. We'll have to reschedule. How about Tuesday afternoon (the 15th)? I have that day off.
No problem, Mingqiang. Work comes first. Let's reschedule to 2 PM on the 15th, still at Wanlvyuan Park. I happen to be off on Tuesday as well.

Juanzi, Dad just called and said there's an old appliance at home that's malfunctioning. He got a slight electric shock while taking a shower, which really startled him. I need to go check it out right after work. Please have dinner without me.
Huh? Is everyone okay? Go check it out quickly, it must be an electrical leak. Take your tools and be careful! I'll save dinner for you.

Jian Guo, I fixed it for my dad yesterday. It was that old water heater that had been used for almost twenty years. The insulation of the internal heating element had aged, causing the outer shell to become electrified. The power has been cut off, and I told them not to use it for now. We need to buy a new one.

This old thing really needs to be replaced—it's a major safety hazard. If you need help picking a model or with the installation, just let me know. It's a real stroke of luck that the old man didn't get electrocuted.

Boss Zhang, this is Mingqiang. Jianguo had an accident at the renovation site of the old residential area in Xiuying District. He was hit by something falling from above and has been taken to the hospital. I'm on my way there now.
Got it! I'll notify Manager Liu and the Safety Department right away. You guys take care of Jianguo first, and I'll head over as soon as I finish what I'm doing. Which hospital is it?

Honey, Jianguo's test results are out. He has a fracture in his left scapula and needs to be hospitalized for observation for a few days. It happened when an old, rusty fixed bracket suddenly came loose and fell on him while he was dismantling the old wiring. Luckily, he was wearing a safety helmet, so his head wasn’t injured.

Oh my god, that's so dangerous! You must be extremely careful too! Please take care of Jian Guo's family these few days, and let us know if there's anything we can help with. Will you be back for dinner tonight?

Brother Mingqiang, I recently watched a few old war movies, and they were really good. "Saving Private Ryan" goes without saying—it's a classic. I also discovered "The Thin Red Line," which is about the Pacific War. Its cinematography and storytelling are quite unique, and I think you'd enjoy it.
Received. I've been busy preparing for certification exams recently and haven't had time to watch. I'll definitely catch up after the exams. I've noted down the two titles you mentioned.

Brother Mingqiang, you can relax after finishing the exams, right? Let me recommend two lesser-known but amazing movies: "Hacksaw Ridge" and "Fury." One tells the story of a medic, and the other is about a tank crew. Both are incredibly realistic and impactful.
Just finished the exam, I really need a break. You've got quite a collection here, two more movies. Alright, I've added them to my watchlist. Thanks for the recommendations!
Jianguo, the line maintenance finished early today. How about grabbing a couple of drinks at our usual spot after work?
Sure, I'm almost done too. Let's go to that big open-air food stall at the entrance of Baishamen Park. Their grilled fish is the most authentic.
Mingqiang, my dad brought some small dried fish that he sun-dried himself from our hometown. I'll bring some for you when we go fly kites next week—they pair perfectly with beer.

Great! Thanks, Ah Jie. By the way, last week when we were eating at that big open-air restaurant at the entrance of Baishamen Park, the boss mentioned that they recently got a batch of pretty good fish.
Jay, I tried the new method you mentioned last time for making the kite turn more flexibly, and it really works much better than the old technique I used before.
Haha, right! The key lies in the positioning of the strings, and when they are well-coordinated with the stress points of the kite frame, the controllability improves significantly.

Brother Qiang, I've sketched a draft of the improved eagle kite. The key modification is replacing the traditional two-point bridle with a more precise three-point positioning method, and I've also made adjustments to the frame. Please take a look when you have time.
The picture has been received. Three-point positioning? That's an interesting idea, let me think about it.
Honey, Xuanxuan said he's almost finished with his summer homework and wants me to take him to the movies this weekend. He mentioned wanting to watch something with lots of robots and lots of action.
Okay. He's been talking about it for a long time, saying all his classmates have seen it—it's a story about a robot going on an adventure in outer space. Check the movie schedule for me.
Dad, Xiaoming in my class says "Star Guardians" is really good. It's about a robot team exploring new planets and fighting bad guys—it's an adventure cartoon! Can you take me to see it?
That sounds good. When the holiday comes, if you finish your homework well, Dad will take you there.

Jianguo, I just saw a pretty typical case study on the forum. It's about an old residential area with aging electrical circuits, and the symptoms are quite unusual—not just a simple circuit breaker trip.
Oh? What symptoms? Tell me, so I can have a reference if I encounter it in the future.

Bro, about the old community's electrical circuit issue you mentioned seeing on the forum last time, specifically, does the light flicker at night? It seems like our community has been experiencing a similar situation recently.

Yes, that's the one. The experienced electrician who posted mentioned that a typical symptom is during the peak electricity usage hours around 7 to 8 p.m., the lights in public corridors will flicker rhythmically like a heartbeat, but there's no issue during the day. It's most likely due to poor contact in the main neutral wire.

Jay, you know that new fishing rod I bought the other day? I was thinking, could we use the experience from making carbon fiber tubes for kite frames to transform it into an ultra-lightweight, detachable support pole for a large kite?
That's quite a cross-disciplinary idea! Which rod did you buy? It can't be too stiff or too soft, right?
Brother Qiang, have you heard back about the deep-sea fishing gear I asked you to inquire about last time? Preferably a sturdy and durable sea fishing rod.

Asked at a local fishing tackle shop. The owner recommended the "Lang" series from Guangwei, a 2.1-meter sea fishing rod, saying it offers good value for money and decent rod elasticity. I also bought one myself to try it out.
A-Feng, you mentioned last week during the game that Hainan is going to host a new sports event. What exactly is it? I think I saw something about it in the news.
"The Huanqiong International Road Cycling Race," I heard it's the first time it's being held, and the standards are quite high. The news was just announced when we were playing ball.
Bin, I saw on the news that Hainan is going to host a round-the-island cycling race this year, and it seems to be scheduled for the second half of the year.
Yes, I heard customers talking about it during my deliveries. They said it's tentatively scheduled for November, covering over a thousand kilometers and passing through many cities and counties.

Jianguo, I have a question for you. The old factory in Xiuying District has a distribution cabinet from the 1980s that keeps tripping the main switch. We've checked the wiring and load, and nothing is overloaded. Do you recall any similar cases? Let's discuss it in detail at work tomorrow.

Regarding the old cabinet issue you mentioned last time, I went to the city library on Saturday to look through old journals and actually found a case from the 1985 issue of "Hainan Electric Power" that is almost identical to your situation. It was caused by internal busbar insulation aging leading to intermittent short circuits. I've sent you the picture; take a look.

Hai Zi, I've been thinking about getting a new phone lately. I want one with a long-lasting battery and clear camera quality, mainly for browsing the internet, watching videos, and occasionally playing some light games. My budget is around 2,500 yuan. Since you're in this line of work, could you recommend something?

Both Model A and Model B are good options at this price range. Model A is widely recognized for its excellent battery life, which can easily last a full day even with heavy usage, and its system runs smoothly. Model B, on the other hand, has slightly better photo processing algorithms and a brighter screen. It really depends on which aspect you prioritize more.

Hai Zi, I've received the phone, model A. The battery life is truly impressive—I charged it fully yesterday, and after a busy day today, it still has 40% left when I got home. I took some photos to show Juanzi and the kids, and they said they look quite clear. Thanks, bro!

Ming Qiang, my son's school has started a squash interest class, and he really enjoys it. I'm thinking of buying him a more professional racket as a birthday gift. What brand do you use? Any recommendations?

I ran into A-Feng at the sports hall today. He noticed that the strings on my racket were loose and even helped me tighten them. He’s been using that X-brand racket for almost three years now and says it still feels consistently reliable.
Jianguo, I asked some fellow players, and they all said that for beginners, the balanced type from X brand is quite good—durable and with a nice feel. You might want to check it out.
Brother-in-law, I'll be back in Haikou for the National Day. Are there any Shenzhen specialties that Xuanxuan and Hanhan would like to eat? I'll prepare them in advance.
That's perfect, they both love sweet pastries. Just bring whatever you think is suitable, and be careful on the road.
Ah Qiang just called and said he bought wife cakes and chicken biscuits, both from that time-honored brand in Shenzhen. The kids are in for a treat.

Mingqiang, are you home? I was cleaning out the old house and found a liquor bottle. It's white porcelain with a coconut tree painted on it, and it says "Coconut Island Daqu." It seems to be from the 1980s. You know about these things—could you take a look at it for me?
Uncle Wang, these local famous liquor bottles from old state-owned distilleries hold quite some nostalgic value nowadays. I'll go online tonight to help you look up some information.
Old Chen, is that 'Old Wine Collection Website' you mentioned last time reliable? I want to look up some information about an old Hainan wine bottle.

Reliable, there are many experienced masters on there. Last time, I found information about the old Wenchang wine label by asking on that platform. What are you looking for? Send a picture, and I'll help you take a look together.
Ming Qiang, are you free this weekend? I heard a new barbecue restaurant just opened in Meilan District, and it's said to be absolutely delicious. I’ve been wanting to try it. Want to go together?
Sure, this week isn't too busy for me. Just let me know the time and place once you've decided.
A Bin, did you go to 'Old Wang Barbecue' after your run last week? How was the taste? Wu Gang invited me to go there this weekend.

Yeah! The butter and grilled fish are absolutely amazing! The only thing is, it's always crowded and you have to wait in line. I even ran into Wu Gang there that day—he was with a few of his colleagues.

(To 'Old Chen') Old Chen, I got really lucky today! I found a wine bottle at the flea market that I've been thinking about for years, and it's in perfect condition. I'll show it to you some other day.
(Sent to 'Old Chen') Last week, I used that Wuliangye bottle to trade with an online collector for an old Jingzhi Baigan bottle from the 1980s. It was a win-win situation for both of us.
(Received from 'Juanzi') You came back quite late today?

(To 'Juanzi') Well, I went to play ball today and ran into an acquaintance at the squash court. We chatted for a bit. He also recommended the racket I'm using now, saying it offers great value for money. I bought it last month based on his suggestion, and it really works well.
(To 'Dad') Dad, I saw Juanzi's WeChat Moments. Thank you for taking Xuanxuan and Hanhan to the beach today—they must have had a blast. I just finished the emergency repair work here.
(Received from 'Dad') It's fine, the two little ones are having a blast. Your mom brought them boiled eggs and fruit. You've been working hard, so take care and stay safe.
(Received from 'Jianguo (Workmate)') Mingqiang, guess what? I got first place in the company's skills competition today! There's a prize that's just what I wanted.

(Received from 'Jianguo (Co-worker)') Today at work, I saw Xiao Zhao carrying a new toolbox, looking quite sharp. He even boasted that he won it in a previous competition, just like mine. These young folks nowadays can't help but show off when they achieve something.

(Received from 'Boss Li') Master Lu, could you help check the electrical lines at the shop this weekend? By the way, I have a friend who is cleaning out a warehouse and seems to have found an old wine bottle. Knowing you collect these, I kept an eye out for you. I heard it's quite rare.

(Received from 'Boss Li') Master Lu, regarding the bottle we discussed last time, my friend sent photos today. It's the collector's edition bottle of Guojiao 1573. I searched online, and even empty bottles like this are being offered for hundreds of yuan now.

(To 'Brother Hua') Bro, Aunt came over for a family gathering today and brought some snacks she made herself. As soon as I tasted them, it reminded me of when we were kids playing at your place, and Grandma used to make the same snacks for us. The taste is exactly the same.

(Received from 'Brother Hua') Are you talking about coconut-flavored glutinous rice cake? I haven't had it for many years either. Auntie's cooking skills are still the best, able to recreate Grandma's flavor.
